docs.lead_paragraph: Regarding ''A region no longer hidebound'' (Page Two, May 2) by Luisita Lopez Torregrosa: When discussing the recent political gains of women in Latin America, you cannot draw a curtain of silence around a movement that has reached deep and wide among rural women, indigenous groups and all sectors of society. For decades, women throughout the region have been fighting for an equal role in political, economic and social spheres. In the face of fierce opposition, we have secured government funding for contraception, succeeded in creating new laws against gender based violence, fought for the right to safe and legal abortion, and promoted sexuality education to empower girls in a region where adolescent pregnancy rates are high.
docs.snippet: For decades, women throughout the region have been fighting for an equal role in political, economic and social spheres.

docs.abstract: Women can develop preeclampsia during the later stages of pregnancy - or even after childbirth. Would you recognize the signs?
docs.snippet: Women can develop preeclampsia during the later stages of pregnancy - or even after childbirth. Would you recognize the signs?

docs.lead_paragraph: Cheri Young, whose husband was a longtime aide to John Edwards, traded jabs with a defense lawyer during cross-examination on Tuesday.

headline.seo: Cheri Young Proves Challenging Witness for Edwards Defense
headline.main: Edwards Defense Team Makes Few Inroads With Ex-Aide’s Wife on Witness Stand
headline.print_headline: Edwards Defense Team Makes Few Inroads With Ex-Aide’s Wife on Witness Stand

docs.abstract: Cheri Young, whose husband Andrew was a longtime aide to John Edwards, trades jabs with defense lawyer during cross-examination in Edwards's federal corruption trial; Edwards is alleged to have used illegal campaign contributions to conceal an affair.
docs.snippet: Cheri Young, whose husband was a longtime aide to John Edwards, traded jabs with a defense lawyer during cross-examination on Tuesday.

headline.main: The Dilemma of the Pregnant Addict

docs.abstract: Protecting infants from opiate exposure scarcely needs argument. It's how to protect a child from exposure when the source is the child's mother that's proved more difficult to resolve.
docs.snippet: Protecting infants from opiate exposure scarcely needs argument. It's how to protect a child from exposure when the source is the child's mother that's proved more difficult to resolve.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study has found that in women at high risk of premature birth, a pessary may delay birth until a newborn has a greater chance of survival.

headline.seo: Pessary Delays Births In Mothers at Risk of Premature Delivery
headline.main: Simple Device Helps Delay Birth to Lift Babies’ Chances of Survival
headline.print_headline: Pregnancy: Simple Device Helps Delay Birth To Lift Babies’ Chances of Survival

docs.abstract: Study published in The Lancet finds that a pessary, small silicon collar placed around the neck of the cervix, may delay birth until a newborn has a greater chance of survival in women at high risk of premature birth.
docs.snippet: A study has found that in women at high risk of premature birth, a pessary may delay birth until a newborn has a greater chance of survival.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fast-growing abuse of prescription drugs has reached maternity wards in hospitals across the country.

headline.seo: Prescription Drug Abuse Soars Among Pregnant Women
headline.main: Abuse of Opiates Soars in Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Abuse of Opiates Soars in Pregnant Women

docs.abstract: Study in The Journal of the American Medical Association highlights the fast-growing abuse of prescription drugs that has reached maternity wards in hospitals across the country; study finds that number of pregnant women addicted to opiate drugs, and the number of babies born experiencing withdrawal symptoms, has risen sharply over the last decade.
docs.snippet: The fast-growing abuse of prescription drugs has reached maternity wards in hospitals across the country.
